instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3323: What is 820-3323? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Will Run on a PSU but on a Charger/Battery
threads.message:
Hello,
Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3323</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>/ This device came without the ssd . No Response when put on charger or off battery. Magsafe light is there.
When connected to a PSU to check current draw the machine boots and gives the question mark sign.

No Corrosion on the board

PPBUS and PP3V42 all ok

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Will Run on a PSU but on a Charger/Battery
threads.message:
I suppose the board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

The mentioned symptom looks like input lekage problem.
But in such case, original charger shouldn't get light.

What is exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Will Run on a PSU but on a Charger/Battery
threads.message:
Original gets light. Knock off doesnt.
PPBUS is 12.56V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 3.3V checked a <CAPACITOR>C7292</CAPACITOR>/93

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Will Run on a PSU but on a Charger/Battery
threads.message:
Then the problem is not leakage related.

Be aware, this machine requires 85W charger, if battery doesn't hold any charge; or is not properly recognized.
Turns on in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Will Run on a PSU but on a Charger/Battery
threads.message: I was using a 60W adapter. Let me ask the customer for a 65W adapter.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Will Run on a PSU but on a Charger/Battery
threads.message:
85W!

It should turn on in SMC bypass even with 45/60W; tried that?
